Comments_List: Pursued an independent project about automata and neural networks.
I enjoyed this course and being able to build my own project. It is a great end to the CS major.
Worked on project planning and scoping. Also learned to manage tasks and find resources to complete my project.

I felt that the senior projects course is all about what the student puts in. If you are dedicated and interested in your project, you'll learn a lot, especially because you might try several different approaches using a number of different methods. However, if you slack off and half-ass your project, you can probably get through the semester without learning anything.
The submit scripts to hand in progress updates at the end of the semester did not work initially, adding unnecessary stress and inconvenience.
It would be helpful to have more information about how the class will be graded.
Lots of freedom to build something cool, but not a lot of guidance in terms of checkpoints or grading criteria.
The biggest strength about this course is how open-ended it is. You can do whatever you want to do.
I ended up dropping this, because I didn't get usable results, but everyone was quite supportive in me continuing the research next semester instead.
I'd recommend taking this before your last semester, since part of the stress was wondering if I'd even finish everything on time.
Yes, I recommend taking this course. But take it seriously and do something you're interested in, because a semester working on something you hate will be a grind.
